posts.name: Kronos
posts.cooked: What do team’s use for basic relays? Looking to just control on and off power to LED’s.

posts.name: Adam Fleming
posts.cooked:
The ones on first choice are a decent option. A little bulky for just LEDs though.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: You might want to look at MOSFETs from pololu.  These are tiny and lightweight and often can be controlled by a DIO or PWM type signal from the Rio’s DIO ports.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
Kronos:

control on and off power to LED

Rev PDH relay

1 Switchable low-current channel On/off control useful for LEDs and other indicators

On/off control useful for LEDs and other indicators

posts.name: Ben Edwards
posts.cooked: A PCM or RPH can be used to control low power LEDs, per R504.  If you are using pneumatics, have extra channels on your PCM/RPH, and are using relatively low power 24v LEDs (or 12v if you’re using 12v solenoids) it’s cheap and easy. If all you have is 12v LEDs and 24v solenoids, you could wire 2 LEDs in series. The PCM is limited to 500mA total for all “solenoid” outputs, the RPH is 200mA per output.

posts.name: Eric Tate
posts.cooked: Small relays like this: [ Arduino Compatible 5V Relay Module - RobotShop ] can be easily interfaced to the RoboRio digital outputs.
